publicwhip.spmotion: *S3M-7843 Jackie Baillie: Congratulations to Eileen McCallum—That the Parliament congratulates Eileen McCallum on winning the Evening Times Scotswoman of the Year Award; acknowledges her determination in fighting for better services for her grandsons with Duchenne muscular dystrophy and the 6,000 people with muscle disease across Scotland; considers that she has shown commitment and enthusiasm in combining care for her grandsons, a successful acting career, influential parliamentary campaigning work and active fundraising; notes her longstanding support for the Muscular Dystrophy Campaign and the key evidence that she provided for the inquiry into specialist care conducted by the Cross-Party Group in the Scottish Parliament on Muscular Dystrophy, which resulted in the publication of the recommendations in The Mackie Report: Access to specialist neuromuscular care and social care in Scotland, and applauds all the women shortlisted for the Scotswoman of the Year Award.
S3M-7843 Congratulations to Eileen McCallum (lodged on 1 February 2011) Jamie Hepburn*

S3M-7843 Congratulations to Eileen McCallum (lodged on 1 February 2011) Bob Doris*, Mary Mulligan*, Patricia Ferguson*, Malcolm Chisholm*, Dr Richard Simpson*, David Whitton*, Karen Gillon*, Mr Frank McAveety*, Jamie McGrigor*, Des McNulty*, Helen Eadie*, Bill Butler*, Trish Godman*, Sarah Boyack*, Robin Harper*

S3M-7843 Jackie Baillie: Congratulations to Eileen McCallum—That the Parliament congratulates Eileen McCallum on winning the Evening Times Scotswoman of the Year Award; acknowledges her determination in fighting for better services for her grandsons with Duchenne muscular dystrophy and the 6,000 people with muscle disease across Scotland; considers that she has shown commitment and enthusiasm in combining care for her grandsons, a successful acting career, influential parliamentary campaigning work and active fundraising; notes her longstanding support for the Muscular Dystrophy Campaign and the key evidence that she provided for the inquiry into specialist care conducted by the Cross-Party Group in the Scottish Parliament on Muscular Dystrophy, which resulted in the publication of the recommendations in The Mackie Report: Access to specialist neuromuscular care and social care in Scotland, and applauds all the women shortlisted for the Scotswoman of the Year Award. Supported by: Jamie Hepburn, Bob Doris, Mary Mulligan, Patricia Ferguson, Malcolm Chisholm, Dr Richard Simpson, David Whitton, Karen Gillon, Mr Frank McAveety, Jamie McGrigor, Des McNulty, Helen Eadie, Bill Butler, Trish Godman, Sarah Boyack, Robin Harper, Karen Whitefield*, Sandra White*, Elaine Smith*
